quotes.quote: It is a principle of diplomacy that one must know something of the truth in order to lie convincingly.
Diplomacy in general does not resolve conflicts. Wars end not due to peace processes, but due to one side giving up.
Sincere diplomacy is no more possible than dry water or wooden iron.
Diplomacy is fundamentally working with people, bringing people together to deal with difficult issues.
Diplomacy is a game of chess in which the nations are checkmated.

Diplomacy is listening to what the other guy needs. Preserving your own position, but listening to the other guy. You have to develop relationships with other people so when the tough times come, you can work together.
Diplomacy is a disguised war, in which states seek to gain by barter and intrigue, by the cleverness of arts, the objectives which they would have to gain more clumsily by means of war.
The art of diplomacy is to take an opportunity and turn it into something.
Quiet diplomacy is far more effective than public posturing.
DIPLOMACY, n. Lying in state, or the patriotic art of lying for one's country.
The best diplomacy starts with getting to know each other.
Diplomacy is like jazz: endless variations on a theme.
Diplomacy is not merely talking somebody into something; it's talking to somebody from a position of strength. You put your power on the table to open up the conversation; that's diplomacy.
In the world of diplomacy, some things are better left unsaid.
Diplomacy, if properly practiced, is not just talking for the sake of talking.
Diplomacy is to do and say the nastiest things in the nicest way.
Diplomacy without arms is like music without instruments.
In diplomacy, like in great many other things, the rules of engagement survive only until one remarkable person decides to break them.
You can do a lot with diplomacy, but with diplomacy backed up by force you can get a lot more done.
Diplomacy means the art of nearly deceiving all your friends, but not quite deceiving all your enemies.
Diplomacy is the art of letting someone else have your way.
Diplomacy is the velvet glove that cloaks the fist of power.
All diplomacy is a continuation of war by other means.
Diplomacy: the art of restraining power.
Diplomacy is thinking twice before saying nothing.
Successful diplomacy is an alignment of objectives and means.
Diplomacy is more than saying or doing the right things at the right time, it is avoiding saying or doing the wrong things at any time.
Diplomacy is much more than just talking to your friends. You've got to talk to people who aren't our friends, and even people you dislike.
Diplomacy is the lowest form of politeness because it misquotes the greatest number of people. A nation, like an individual, if it has anything to say, should simply say it.
Part of diplomacy is to open different definitions of self-interest.
